conclusion: To determine the initial distance between the two cars given the velocity-time (v-t) graph, we'll analyze the area under the curves since the area under a velocity-time graph represents the distance traveled.
Car A starts at 25 m/s and ends at 0 m/s. Car B starts at 15 m/s and ends at 0 m/s.
Car A stops completely in 30 seconds. Car B stops completely in 25 seconds. They just avoided collision at 20 seconds.

premise: Car A starts at 25 m/s and ends at 0 m/s. Time is 20 seconds.
conclusion: Distance traveled by Car A: s_A = 250 meters.

premise: Car B starts at 15 m/s and ends at 0 m/s. Time is 20 seconds.
conclusion: Distance traveled by Car B: s_B = 150 meters.

premise: Distance traveled by Car A: 250 meters. Distance traveled by Car B: 150 meters.
